title: Slow connections in ATL region
customer_symptom: Users reported sluggish apps and choppy calls.
findings: Network delay spiked on a primary path. A backup path remained healthy, suggesting a single route issue rather than a full outage.
mitigation: Traffic was shifted away from the degraded path. Performance returned to normal and stayed stable.

evidence.caption: Network Delay during the incident window

title: Intermittent drops for Site B
customer_symptom: Some users could not load pages; retries usually worked.
findings: Dropped traffic aligned with short link flaps, suggesting an unstable edge connection.
mitigation: Interface was stabilized and monitoring thresholds were tightened for earlier detection.

title: Brief slowdown during peak hour
customer_symptom: A few users noticed pages loading slower than normal.
impact: Small performance dip, limited to a short window.
findings: A temporary congestion spike occurred during a burst of traffic. Performance returned to baseline without sustained degradation.
mitigation: No direct intervention needed. Documented the pattern and added a watch for recurring spikes.

evidence.caption: Network Delay during the incident window

title: Intermittent connection failures for remote users
customer_symptom: Some users could not connect; retries sometimes worked.
impact: Intermittent access failures for a subset of users.
findings: Failures clustered around a single edge path. The pattern matched short-lived instability rather than total outage.
mitigation: Shifted traffic away from the unstable path and monitored until the failure rate dropped to normal.

title: Choppy audio during conference calls
customer_symptom: Calls sounded robotic or cut out for some participants.
impact: Real-time traffic quality degraded for a noticeable portion of sessions.
findings: Packet loss increased during the window and aligned with a network event. Non-real-time traffic was less affected.
mitigation: Adjusted routing preference to avoid the affected segment and kept a tighter watch on drop rate thresholds.

evidence.caption: Drop pattern during the incident window

title: Slow app response from Site C
customer_symptom: Users reported the app felt sluggish and actions took longer to complete.
impact: Performance degradation for users connected through Site C.
findings: Delay increased gradually, peaked, and then stabilized. The pattern suggested a constrained path rather than a full outage.
mitigation: Shifted traffic and confirmed the delay returned to normal levels within the same session.

evidence.caption: Network Delay during the incident window

title: Short outage affecting a single region
customer_symptom: Some users could not load pages at all for a few minutes.
impact: Brief service interruption for a specific region.
findings: A sharp failure spike occurred and recovered quickly. The impact was concentrated, which ruled out broad service failure.
mitigation: Confirmed recovery, validated stability for 30 minutes post-event, and documented for trend tracking.

evidence.caption: Failure spike during the incident window

title: Performance degradation after a configuration change
customer_symptom: Users noticed slow page loads shortly after a routine change window.
impact: Noticeable slowdown across a subset of traffic.
findings: Timing aligned closely with a change window and the degradation pattern was consistent until rollback.
mitigation: Rolled back the change and confirmed performance returned to baseline.

evidence.caption: Delay increase aligned to the change window

title: Intermittent packet loss on backup route
customer_symptom: Most users were fine, but a few saw occasional hiccups.
impact: Minor intermittent impact, mostly masked by failover behavior.
findings: Loss appeared in bursts on the backup path. Primary path remained healthy, indicating localized instability.
mitigation: Kept traffic primarily on the stable route and opened monitoring for recurrence during peak periods.

title: Elevated delay for international traffic
customer_symptom: International users reported slow responses compared to normal.
impact: Higher response times for users outside the primary region.
findings: Delay increased on international routes while local traffic remained normal, pointing to upstream routing conditions.
mitigation: Adjusted routing preference where possible and confirmed the delay returned to normal levels.
